sprite.name: (Unused) Large Object Thrower
sprite.notes:
Used in the Newer Final Boss Fight. This is spawned through Captain Bowser's code. It will throw a larger version of the Projectile at a 45Â° arc.

Use of this sprite is not recommended.
sprite.advancednotes: This sprite is best made use of by spawning it through the Actor Spawner. Projectiles have a very high velocity. It will spawn the object around 5 blocks above the placement of the sprite.

dependency.notes: [95] Hammer Bros is required to be placed in the level if using this sprite with the Object: Hammer setting.

dualbox.comment: This determines the Z-Order of the thrown object.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
Place in Front: +3300 to the Z-Order.
Place Behind: -1804 to the Z-Order.

list.title: Object
list.comment: This determines what object is thrown. These objects are larger than the normal versions.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the object will be thrown.

sprite.name: Custom Model Loader
sprite.notes:
The Custom Model Loader allows the use of pre-scripted Models and Animations for use in user-created cutscenes. It can also provide new models as decoration for your level.

Warning: Will CRASH if [Animate Model] is set and no animation is available.

dependency.notes:
As this sprite will pull Models and Animations from specific .arc files, those sprites are required to be placed within the level to prevent a game crash. The list of required sprites is as follows:

0-6: arrow.arc (143)
7-16: block_arrow.arc (321)
17-24: arrow.arc (143)
25-28: cage_boss_koopa.arc (439)
29-38: kameck_princess.arc (439)
39: CreditsBG.arc (???)
40-42: chestnut.arc (320)
43-48: OpeningScene.arc (273)
49: chestnut.arc (320)

external.title: Model ID
external.comment:
Use this external window to select your Model.

This determines which Model will be used. If [Animate Model] is checked, then the Models will run their coded animation instead of standing still. Values with '---' were not used in Newer levels.

value.title: Scale: Value/4.0
value.comment: This determines the scale of the Model.
value.comment2: Value 0 creates an original-sized Model (100%). Values above 0 are divided by 4 to determine the Model Size. 1=25%, 2=50%, 8=200%, etc.
value.advancedcomment: Value limit unknown. Maximum value suspected to be 24, or 600%

checkbox.title: Animate Model
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the loaded model will activate its attached animation, otherwise the loaded model will be stationary.
checkbox.comment2:
Will CRASH if Animation not present and this is checked.

Known values that must have [Animate Model] left unchecked:
17: Perfect Title Peach's Castle
40-42, 49: Tree Canopy A/B/C/D

list.title: Z-Order
list.comment: This determines the Z-Order of the model.
list.comment2:
Some in-game Z-Order values:
Background: -5500.0
Layer 2: -3300.0
Layer 1: 0.0
Player: 300.0
Foreground: 1200.0
Layer 0: 3300.0
Above Layer 0: 5500.0
list.entry: Use Default Z-Order for Custom Model

sprite.name: Toad House Minigame - Silver Star
sprite.notes: A collection challenge added in NewerSMBW. The player must collect all of the stars within the time limit in order to succeed and trigger an event.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This determines which Event will be activated when all Collectible Stars in the Zone are collected.

list.title: Minimum Number of Players
list.comment: This determines the minimum number of players required to be present for this star to spawn.

sprite.name: Rideable Clowncar with Cannon
sprite.notes:
Used in the NewerSMBW Final Boss Fight. The player can fly around freely and shoot a cannon at a fixed angle.

Not recommended for use outside of the Final Boss Fight.
sprite.advancedcomment: If you do choose to use this vehicle outside of the boss fight, please keep in mind there is no documentation for what issues you might encounter. Be sure to test your level for crashes and glitches. Cannon shots behave similarly but not identically to Bob-omb explosions. Water causes it to react similarly to Yoshi, with the player jumping off and the Clowncar sinking.

value.title: Minimum Number of Players
value.comment: This determines the number of players required for the Clowncar to load. A value of 4 will only load if there are 4 players.

sprite.name: (Unused) Captain Bowser Flame Breath
sprite.notes:
Captain Bowser uses this in the NewerSMBW Final Boss Fight.

Cannot be placed as an individual sprite.

sprite.name: Toad House Minigame - Music House
sprite.notes: This sprite is used to generate the Music House bonus game from NewerSMBW. The blocks will spawn centered on the sprite's placement. Playing the mini-game to completion will cause the level to end in completion.
sprite.advancednotes: Additional songs can be added with a little adjustment to the sprite's code. Simple edits can allow for new songs in your hack.

list.title: 1st Chord Prize
list.comment: This determines the prize awarded for passing the first Chord of the song.

list.title: 2nd Chord Prize
list.comment: This determines the prize awarded for passing the second Chord of the song.

list.title: 3rd Chord Prize
list.comment: This determines the prize awarded for passing the third Chord of the song.

list.title: 4th Chord Prize
list.comment: This determines the prize awarded for passing the fourth Chord of the song.

list.title: Song
list.comment: This determines the song that must be played in the minigame. The number of Stars (*) represents the difficulty. The world the song was used within in Newer is listed in parentheses.

checkbox.title: Always used in NewerSMBW
checkbox.comment: Unknown effect. While this is always used in NewerSMBW's Music Houses, there's no discernable difference between having this enabled and not.

sprite.name: Bomb Drop Controller
sprite.yoshinotes: The Bomb Dropper does work with Yoshi. When the player is hit and he's on Yoshi, he will dismount Yoshi.
sprite.notes:
When one of the Triggering Events is activated, this controller will drop a large exploding spiked ball above either Bowser or a specific player straight down from the height of the sprite's placement.
It will then activate the consecutive Event ID for the Triggered Event after the bomb explodes. The bomb has the same model that Bowser Jr uses in his 3rd boss fight.
sprite.advancednotes: Feeling adventurous? Try making a multiplayer level that uses this sprite to create a versus style game which disables player respawn and triggers an event when only one player is left alive.

value.title: Triggering Event ID #1
value.comment: Activating this Event will drop a bomb on the specified target, and then activate the numerical consecutive Event ID. Finally, the Event ID will be immediately deactivated, and can be reactivated again.

value.title: Triggering Event ID #2
value.comment: Activating this Event will drop a bomb on the specified target, and then activate the numerical consecutive Event ID. Finally, the Event ID will be immediately deactivated, and can be reactivated again.

list.title: Target
list.comment: This determines which target the bomb will drop above. Players have the ability to outrun the bomb.

sprite.name: Lighting - Music House Glow Block
sprite.notes: These are the colored Glow Blocks that act like normal blocks. They can be spawned by [15] in NewerSMBW's Music Houses. They can either be used as decoration, or as an item block.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the glow block will play a note when struck or award an item.

list.title: Item
list.comment: This determines the item rewarded.
list.comment2: [Bug] Block will award unlimited items.
list.advancedcomment: The block can be set to both award an item and play a musical note, but it is not recommended.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the glow block. Value 0 has no recolor in the 'block_light.arc' file. If a color (white) was added, it would work fine.

list.title: Color & Note
list.comment: This determines which note is played when a player hits the block. <font color="Red">*[Bug] Value 0: Nothing - C1â¯ currently crashes the game.</font>

sprite.name: Spine Coaster Platform
sprite.notes: This creates immobile 'Spine Coaster' Platforms (1x2). The Sprite's placement represents the right side of the Platform.

dependency.notes: The normal Spine Coaster [297] must be placed somewhere in your level. It does not have to be part of a zone.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the platform is flat (horizontal), or if it is tilted at an angle.
This determines which direction the platform will be angled.

list.title: Angle
list.comment: This determines the amount of tilt the platform will have.
list.comment2: Angles greater than 45Â° have glitchy collision and are not recommended.

list.title: Angle
list.comment: This determines the amount of tilt the platform will have.
list.comment2: Angles greater than 45Â° have glitchy collision and are not recommended.

list.title: Segment
list.comment: This determines which segment of the Spine Coaster is used.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the platform will face.

dependency.notes: The boss works fine without any other required sprite.

dualbox.comment: Affects certain cinematics and boss difficulty.

sprite.name: Goomba
sprite.notes: Your standard Goomba. Place it in the level and it will walk towards Mario when it loads.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Goomba.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Goomba placing it further behind other sprites.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This determines what animation state is used by the Goomba when it is first loaded. This is useful for Goombas within range of a nearby Entrance.
list.comment2: Jumps and 'Tumble' will result in it landing on the next platform below where it was initially placed.

sprite.name: Paragoomba
sprite.notes: A Goomba with wings that will flutter towards Mario when it loads.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Paragoomba.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Paragoomba placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Pumpkin Goomba
sprite.notes: A Goomba inside a pumpkin. The pumpkin adds an extra hit point to the Goomba.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Pumpkin Goomba behaves like a normal Goomba or like a Paragoomba.

sprite.name: Buzzy Beetle
sprite.notes: A standard Buzzy Beetle enemy that walks towards the player when it loads.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Buzzy Beetle.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Buzzy Beetle will be upside-down and able to cling to and walk on ceilings if placed adjacent to them. If not placed adjacent, he will immediately fall and spin towards the player.

checkbox.title: Inside Shell
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Buzzy Beetle will spawn inside his shell. He will eventually climb out and resume walking, even if set to be upside-down. Upside-down shells will fall without spinning towards the player.

sprite.name: Spiny
sprite.notes: A Spiny that walks along the ground.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spiny.
list.comment2: Any Spiny that uses the Balled Up animation will initially use the original red color. Additionally, the Sidestepper's shell has no texture, so it flickers through all the other colors.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This will determine which animation state is used by the Spiny when it is first loaded.

sprite.name: Upside-Down Spiny
sprite.notes: An upside-down Spiny that clings to the ceiling. They will only function when attached to flat ceilings, and do not follow slopes or walk around edges. When placed mid-air, they will fall and attack upon loading.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spiny.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 8
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in retail Ambush Stages. Causes a bugged attribute if the Spiny is placed non-adjacent to ceiling terrain with this checked. Unknown purpose.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 06-02. May relate to how the Spiny interacts with slanted terrain, blocks, POW effects, or causes the Spiny to load from much further away.

sprite.name: Grey Tiled Block
sprite.notes: This is a resizable stone block that was not used in retail NSMBW. Be aware that you cannot synchronize this block for level-wide timing purposes.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the block is.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines how wide the block is.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines the initial direction the block will travel.

checkbox.title: Offset Delay
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will wait two game seconds before moving the first time. This is important for adjusting timing in athletic levels.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its outwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This defines how many tiles the block will move before returning to its starting position.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its return movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the block's movement.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will only appear if the Triggering Event ID is activated.
checkbox.comment2: Note: The block will not disappear when the event is deactivated, for as long as it remains loaded on screen. The player must place enough distance between them and the block's spawning location for it to despawn.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This determines which Event must be activated for the platform to appear.

sprite.name: ?-Switch
sprite.notes: This is the basic stand-alone switch. When triggered, it modifies the Target Event.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines which Symbol is seen on the switch. This allows you to communicate different things about the expected function of the switch.
list.comment2: [Bug] All color values other than the original will spawn one block further upwards than it should. This is accounted for in the sprite image.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: P-Switch
sprite.notes:
This switch is similar to the ? Switch, but it has the additional effect of causing all Blue Coins (tileset-based and sprite-based) to appear, turning empty Brick Blocks into Coins, and turning Coins into empty Brick Blocks. This additional functionality only occurs when using the Timed Event mode, but a Target Event is not required to make use of this functionality.

Do not use this switch around Dancing Controlled Brick Blocks, as the collision data for the transformed coins remains as if it were a block.

dependency.notes: Activates 'Pow Block Coin' tileset tiles.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines which style is seen on the switch. While the P-Switch supports SpriteTex, there aren't any custom textures for it.
list.comment2: [Bug] All color values other than the original will spawn one block further upwards than it should. This is accounted for in the sprite image.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing down. Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms. It does not work with conveyor belts.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Blue Coins, or transform blocks and coins.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Blue Coins will not become visible.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This will determine if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This will set how long the switch takes to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: !-Switch
sprite.notes: This switch is similar to the ?-Switch, but it has the additional effect of changing all outlined Red Blocks (Pa0 Object 57) into solid Red Blocks. This also applies to any outlined Red Blocks spawned by a Tile God. This additional functionality only occurs when using the Timed Event mode, but a Target Event is not required to make use of this functionality.

dependency.notes: Activates 'Red Block Outline A/B' tiles.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines what color the switch is. Different colored switches do not activate different colors of blocks.
list.comment2: [Bug] All color values other than the original will spawn one block further upwards than it should. This is accounted for in the sprite image.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down

checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Red Blocks will not become solid.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: Brick Block ?-Switch
sprite.notes: This is the basic stand-alone switch stored inside a Brick Block. When triggered, it modifies the Target Event.
sprite.advancednotes: A brick block containing or supporting a switch cannot be destroyed by sprites that destroy normal brick and solid blocks as long as the switch exists.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines which Symbol is seen on the switch. This allows you to communicate different things about the expected function of the switch.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will forcibly spawn on the underside of the block facing down, even if struck from below.
checkbox.comment2: Brick-Block switches cannot be set to fall, even if Upside-Down is unchecked.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed.

sprite.name: Lava Bubble (Podoboo)
sprite.notes: The Lava Bubble (Podoboo) is a firey enemy that will jump up from the lava to the height it is placed at. It can only jump a maximum of 15 blocks above the lava.

dependency.notes: The Podoboo requires [139] Lava within 15 blocks underneath it in order to appear.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Podoboo.

value.title: Delay Between Jumps
value.comment: This determines the delay between each of the Podoboo's jumps.
value.comment2: Each value is approximately 1 game second. Podoboos first load in the air at the top of their jump, so a Podoboo with a large delay value may not even interact with the player as they run by.

sprite.name: Thwomp
sprite.notes: A normal sized Thwomp that will try to crush the player when it is nearby or underneath. Thwomps are not capable of destroying tileset objects unless set to Crush Forever.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Thwomp will return to its starting position or if it will continue to crush the terrain until dropping out of the level.
dualbox.comment2: If you use Crush Forever, the Thwomp must be able to fall completely through and well beyond the bottom border of the Zone, or the falling sound effect and rumble will not stop.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Thwomp.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12 (1)
checkbox.comment: An unknown setting for Nybble 12.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Bit 47-48 may be a list, but only value 2 has been defined. Value 3 is confirmed to CRASH the game, so do not activate this with Crush Forever. However, value 1 may provide different effects. Experimenting and testing are required.

sprite.name: Big Thwomp
sprite.notes: A larger Thwomp that will try to crush the player when it is nearby or underneath. Big Thwomps are capable of destroying certain types of tileset objects such as brick blocks and grey blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Thwomp will return to its starting position after crushing up to one row of breakable terrain, or if it will continue to crush the terrain until dropping out of the level.
dualbox.comment2: If you use Crush Forever, the Thwomp must be able to fall completely through and well beyond the bottom border of the Zone, or the falling sound effect and rumble will not stop.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Big Thwomp.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12 (1)
checkbox.comment: An unknown setting for Nybble 12.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Bit 47-48 may be a list, but only value 2 has been defined. Value 3 is confirmed to CRASH the game, so do not activate this with Crush Forever. However, value 1 may provide different effects. Experimenting and testing are required.

sprite.name: Fake Star Coin
sprite.notes: This coin an appearance similar to a normal Star Coin, but when the player tries to collect it, it will vanish and disperse into 4 harmless Boos like a Fake Door.

dependency.notes: A real Star Coin must be placed within the same Zone.

sprite.name: Koopa Troopa
sprite.notes: Your standard Koopa Troopa. Place it in the level and it will walk towards Mario when it loads. It can either be set to walk off ledges, or turn around at ledges.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Koopa Troopa will mindlessly walk off of ledges or if it will turn around when it reaches a ledge.
dualbox.comment2: This also changes the color of the Koopa Troopa.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Koopa Troopa.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Koopa Troopa.

list.title: Load State
list.comment: This determines what animation state the Koopa Troopa will load as.
list.comment2:
Normal: The Koopa Troopa will be walking normally when loaded.

Loads as Shell: The Koopa Troopa will load inside its shell and then return to normal.

Stays in Shell: The Koopa Troopa will load inside its shell and not return to normal. However, it cannot be kicked until jumped on and will instead hurt the player.

checkbox.title: Empty Shell
checkbox.comment: When enabled, a empty kickable shell is spawned instead of a Koopa Troopa.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Chainlink Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Koopa Troopa will walk behind Chainlink Fences.

sprite.name: Koopa Paratroopa
sprite.notes: Your standard Koopa Paratroopa. Place it in the level and it will jump around or fly. Once stomped, it can either be set to walk off ledges, or turn around at ledges.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines the primary type of movement behavior of the Koopa Paratroopa. Flying Paratroopas move 9 blocks total.
list.advancedcomment: Mode 3 spawns a floating shell that cannot be picked up. When Mario hits it from the side, he takes damage, but when the jumps on it, it falls to the ground and becomes a regular shell that can be picked up.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: This determines how the Paratroopa will move upon load.
list.advancedcomment: Glitchy Behavior: The Paratroopa will bounce [] while facing the opposite direction. Once de-winged, the Koopa Troopa will walk in place while continuing to face the same direction.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: This determines how the Paratroopa will move upon load.

dualbox.title1: Moves in specified direction (4 blocks), then turns around
dualbox.comment: This determines how far the Flying Paratroopa will move before first turning around. The Paratroopa will always have a path of 9 Blocks, so this only sets the initial movement distance on load.

dualbox.title1: Moves in specified direction (4 blocks), then turns around
dualbox.comment: This determines how far the Flying Paratroopa will move before first turning around. The Paratroopa will always have a path of 9 Blocks, so this only sets the initial movement distance on load.
This determines if the Koopa Troopa, once stepped on and de-winged, will mindlessly walk off of ledges or if it will turn around when it reaches a ledge.
dualbox.comment2: This also changes the color of the Koopa Troopa.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Koopa Paratroopa.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Koopa Paratroopa.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Chainlink Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Koopa Paratroopa will be able to move behind Chainlink Fences.

sprite.name: Spike Top
sprite.notes: A Buzzy Beetle type enemy with a spike on top of it. It will follow and wrap around terrain and blocks.
sprite.advancednotes: Spike Tops don't properly work on slopes.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: The Spike Top must be placed against something for it to appear.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Spike Top will walk.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spike Top.
list.comment2: Value 5 will turn the Spike Top into a Lil'Sparky. Use Sizehacks if you want a Hothead.

sprite.name: Spiked Ball / Snowball
sprite.notes: A loose Spiked Ball that will also destroy certain types of blocks. It can also be turned into a Snowball.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Spiked Ball.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Spiked Ball will begin rolling in.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines how fast the Spiked Ball rolls.

list.title: Speed After Hitting Wall
list.comment: This determines if the Spiked Ball will slow down after hitting a wall.

sprite.name: Bouncy Cloud
sprite.notes: A cloud platform with a happy face that the player can bounce on to jump really high. NewerSMBW adds more style options including Mushrooms and Checkered Block.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Bouncy Cloud.
list.comment2: If you want the Angry Cloud to hurt players, you have to add an invisible tileset piece to do that for you. Sorry.

checkbox.title: Larger Cloud
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Bouncy Cloud will be bigger.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Looper (While X, do Y THEN Z+, Repeat)
sprite.notes: Similar to the Multi-Chainer, this controller will activate a sequence of Events ranging from [Target Event ID Start] through [Target Event ID End]. However, it will only activate one event at a time. After activating one event, it will deactivate it and activate the next event. Once it has done this for all events, if the [Triggering Event ID] is still activated, it will return to [Target Event ID Start] and begin again.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This event will activate the Event Looper going from the Start ID to the End ID, and back again so long as this event is still active.

value.title: Target Event ID Start
value.comment: When the Triggering Event is activated, this Event ID will be activated first. It will then run until it reaches [Target Event ID End].

value.title: Target Event ID End
value.comment: After enabling and disabling this event, if the Triggering Event is still activated, the Looper will return to [Target Event ID Start] and repeat the loop.

value.title: Delay
value.comment:
This determines the amount of frames the Looper will wait between activating/deactivating each event.

The code for this specifically is a bit messy. The entered value is multiplied by 10, and then 10 is added. However, it can only be a value from 0-255, and any number past that loops. For example, value 24 would be 250 frames of delay.
It's easier to follow these expressions:

0-24 is 'value * 10 + 10' frames
25-50 is (value - 25) * 10 + 4 frames
51-101 is (value - 51) * 10 + 8 frames
102-126 is (value - 102) * 10 + 6.

Finally, value 127 would be 0 frames of delay, and values 128-255 are essentially the same as 0-127.

sprite.name: Actor Spawner
sprite.notes:
With this sprite, you can spawn anything and everything that exists in the game. Sprite Data can be applied to sprites spawned through this within certain limitations. Please utilize Raw Data (Visible with Advanced Settings enabled) to determine what the settings should be set to. Combine the Actor Spawner with [332] Effect/Sound Spawner to add flair to the spawn effect.

Additionally, anything spawned by the Actor Spawner will need to be respawned each time the player changes Zones. If returning from a bonus room, be sure to trigger any relevant spawns. Each Actor Spawner can only trigger once each Zone.

dependency.notes: Directly place any sprite you want to spawn with the Actor Spawner somewhere in your level for the game to load the required secondary assets of that sprite.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this event is activated, the Actor Spawner will create one copy of the Actor at the location of the Spawner. Keep in mind that some sprites have abnormal placement so expect a lot of testing to make sure that everything works correctly.

checkbox.title: Automatically Respawn
checkbox.comment: When the actor spawned by this spawner is deleted or missing, and the event is triggered, another actor with the same settings will be spawned. This also stops the spawned actor from despawning when the event is deactivated.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Actor.

sprite.name: Actor Multi-Spawner
sprite.notes:
With this sprite, you can spawn anything and everything that exists in the game. It will spawn the Actor every 2 seconds while the Triggering Event is on. If you need to spawn them at a faster rate, use an Event Controller to deactivate and activate the Triggering Event. Sprite Data can be applied to sprites spawned through this within certain limitations. Please utilize Raw Data (Visible with Advanced Settings enabled) to determine what the settings should be set to. Combine the Actor Spawner with [332] Effect/Sound Spawner to add flair to the spawn effect.

Additionally, anything spawned by the Actor Spawner will need to be respawned each time the player changes Zones. If returning from a bonus room, be sure to trigger any relevant spawns. Each Actor Spawner can only trigger once each Zone.

dependency.notes: Directly place any sprite you want to spawn with the Actor Spawner somewhere in your level for the game to load the required secondary assets of that sprite.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: While this event is activated, the Actor Spawner will create a copy of the Actor every 2 seconds at the location of the Spawner. Keep in mind that some sprites have abnormal placement so expect a lot of testing to make sure that everything works correctly.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Actor.

sprite.name: Hammer Bro Plus
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that throws hammers (or other objects!) at the player.

dependency.notes: The Hammer Bro will first calculate where the nearest solid ground is. This is defined as a terrain object with solid block collision. With a platform limit of one, he can jump onto any passthrough terrain or brick blocks above this solid ground at a distance of 4. With a platform limit of two, he can jump between this platform and another one above it. When on the top of this platform limit, he will not try and jump upwards. He can also jump down from passthrough terrain set higher than 8 blocks above the solid ground, though he will not be able to return.

dualbox.comment: This determines the number of Platforms the AI of the Hammer Bro tries to make use of. See Dependency Notes for more information.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Hammer Bro.

list.title: Thrown Object
list.comment:
This determines which object will be thrown by the Hammer Bro Plus.
For values 1-3 and 5, the corresponding sprite must be in the level. Otherwise, the Hammer Bro will crash game on load.

sprite.name: Giant Spiked Ball/Snowball
sprite.notes: A large loose Spiked Ball that will also destroy certain types of blocks. Can also be turned into a Snowball.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Giant Spiked Ball.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Spiked Ball will begin rolling in.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines how fast the Spiked Ball rolls.

list.title: Speed After Hitting Wall
list.comment: This determines if the Spiked Ball will slow down after hitting a wall.

sprite.name: Pipe Enemy Spawner
sprite.notes: The spawner must be placed on layer 1 tiles set to the core type 'Pipe'.

sprite.name: Bob-Omb
sprite.notes: A standard Bob-Omb enemy. It will spawn walking towards the player and will fall off of ledges. When stepped on or struck with a fireball, it will eventually explode damaging certain types of blocks, terrain, and enemies.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Bob-Omb.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This determines what animation state is used by the Bob-Omb when it is first loaded. This is used by the sprite indicated, so refer to them for more information.
list.comment2:
Frozen in Ice (Minus Ice): The Bob-Omb is static and lacks collision.
Pipe Spawn: The spawn-in animation is in front of Layer 1.

sprite.name: Pokey
sprite.notes: A tall segmented enemy whose pieces must be destroyed individually unless the head is defeated first.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the Pokey is. One piece will be the head, and every other piece is a body piece.
list.comment2: The height value also affects what Yoshi lays when consumed whole.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Pokey.

sprite.name: Message Box Controller
sprite.notes: This controller is required for all Message Boxes to function correctly. It must be placed in every Zone that uses a Message Box.

dependency.notes: This is used alongside [152] Message Box to produce blocks capable of spawning a pop-up Message Box.

sprite.name: Custom Model Loader Resources (arrow.arc)
sprite.notes: This stores some of the models used by NewerSMBW for their cinematics. <font color="red">This sprite freezes the game if it shows up on-screen.

dependency.notes: If using option 0-6 or 17-24 of the Custom Model Loader (11), you'll need one of these placed somewhere in the level. It does not have to be within a Zone or in the same Area.

sprite.name: Floating Barrel
sprite.notes: A floating barrel that can only be placed on a liquid surface. It will sink while a player is standing on it, but will pop back up once the player jumps off. The barrel can also flow with the unused water current controller.

dependency.notes: The Floating Barrel will not load when placed on the same screen as an entrance. Place the Floating Barrel where you want it to load using the liquid line, and it will spawn floating at the surface line of that body of liquid. It only works with non-Location liquids, and it does work with Moving liquids when placed correctly. Unlike Floating Coins / ? Blocks, it will also function with Rising/Falling Water. Lastly, it should be noted that the visual splash effect is always made of water.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Floating Barrel.

checkbox.title: Initially Submerged
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the floating barrel will load partially submerged.

sprite.name: Message Box
sprite.notes: A block that the player can hit which will display a custom message. Messages are defined in Messages.bin.

dependency.notes: The Message Box Controller must be included in each Zone for Message Boxes to function correctly.

value.title: Message ID
value.comment: Messages defined in Messages.bin. Add 256 to the ID of the message in the Newer Messages Editor program.

sprite.name: (Unused) ?-Switch
sprite.notes: An exact duplicate of the normal ?-Switch.

dependency.notes: The game will crash unless a normal orange switch is placed somewhere in the level. It does not have to be within an area that is actually used.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines which Symbol is seen on the switch. This allows you to communicate different things about the expected function of the switch.
list.comment2: [Bug] All color values other than the original will spawn one block further upwards than it should. This is accounted for in the sprite image.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: Big Pumpkin
sprite.notes: No matter what is inside, the pumpkin can easily be broken with a ground pound. It can even be broken by small Mario.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines if anything appears from inside the block when it is destroyed.

value.title: Withstands (Needs Multiple Hits)
value.comment: This determines the number of hits or ground-pounds needed for the block to break. For this function, a texture will be used that has some odd-looking white numbers on it.
value.advancedcomment: This setting may only apply to the original Giant Breakable Brick Block

sprite.name: Snake Block (Ice)
sprite.notes: Snake Blocks do not have ice collision in Newer.

dependency.notes: The sprite snaps to the Path Node location. From Node-0 to Node-1, it must be a straight horizontal line, and it must be at least as long as the Snake Block itself. Straight lines and exact 45Â° angles are recommended, as after each Node, the Snake Block will navigate in a 1-by-1 zigzag until it reaches the height of the next Node before going straight.

value.title: Starting Node
value.comment: This determines the Node of the Path that the Snake Block will start moving from.

list.title: End Animation
list.comment: This determines what the Snake Block will do when it reaches the final Node of the Path. Values higher than 3 cause a crash.

list.title: Size
list.comment: Sizes share no functional difference. This is separate from SizeHacks.

sprite.name: Thundercloud
sprite.notes: This creates an unhappy Thundercloud that is similar to a Lakitu's cloud. It will slingshot around the top of the stage and occasionally shoot down Thunder. This Thunder will turn non-tiny Marios into Mini-Mario, and kill Mini-Marios outright. The Thunder will not reach beneath solid terrain.

dependency.notes: The controller for Bowser Jr's 2nd Fight must be included somewhere in the level for the electricity to draw properly.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Thundercloud will chase the player, or if it will remain in a single position.

value.title: Triggering Event ID (Die)
value.comment: When the Triggering Event is activated, the Thundercloud will die.

value.title: Triggering Event ID (Thunder)
value.comment: If a Triggering Event is set, the Thundercloud will only shoot thunder while this Event is activated. If a Triggering Event is not set, it will shoot thunder for 3 seconds on, 1 second off (?).

checkbox.title: Does Not Respawn
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Thundercloud will not respawn on its own after being killed by the player. Otherwise the Thundercloud will continue to respawn once loaded until the Triggering Event is activated.

sprite.name: Magic Platform
sprite.notes: Magic Platforms are created by assigning tileset data on Layer 1 to an invisible block as a new texture, and moving that texture around. While it functions best as a moving platform, the Magic Platform does not have to move in order to perform its function. It can also simply create terrain chunks with a different type of collision than normal.

dependency.notes: It should be noted that the Magic Platform can only create rectangular shapes. It cannot have slopes, and it cannot have 'unused space' within the location. All tiles will turn into solid blocks.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines what the Magic Platform looks like. It will clone the Layer 1 tiles as it sees them within the given Location. This Location does not have to be within the current Zone boundaries.

list.title: Collision
list.comment: This determines the type of collision.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: Changes the Z-Order of the Magic Platform to place it behind Layer 2.
value.comment2: Higher values are further behind other Magic Platforms.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event is activated, the Magic Platform will move as specified. When the Event is deactivated, the Magic Platform will return to its starting position.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the Magic Platform will move.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed at which the Magic Platform will move.
value.comment2: The speed increases by a factor of .2 per increment. It must be set greater than 0 for the Magic Platform to move at all.

checkbox.title: Move Forever
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Magic Platform will move in the assigned direction while the Triggering Event is activated, and will move in the opposite direction while the Triggering Event is deactivated.

list.title: Distance
list.comment: This determines how far the Magic Platform will be moved when the Triggering Event is activated.

list.title: Contains
list.comment: Unlisted values are Empty.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 5 (1)
checkbox.comment: Used in Retail: 06-05 A2. Possibly distance related.

dualbox.comment: Share no functional difference.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: The fish will spawn from below the camera line, attacking the player only while they are within this location.

sprite.name: Meteor
sprite.notes: A floating, spinning, usually safe to stand on Meteor.

value.title: Size
value.comment: This determines how large the Meteor is.
value.comment2: A setting of 0 is the same as a setting of 5. 1-255 provide general scaling from 20% to 5100% scaling.

checkbox.title: Electrified
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Meteor will be electrified, and will hurt any player that touches it.

value.title: Rotation Speed
value.comment: This determines how fast the Meteor will rotate, if at all.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Meteor will spin.

list.title: Spawn Item when Destroyed
list.comment: This determines if an item will appear when the Meteor is destroyed.
list.comment2: The Meteor can only be destroyed by the Rideable Clowncar. The Mushroom Bubbles will float in from the right of the screen after the Meteor is destroyed.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Meteors in relation to other objects.
value.comment2: A higher value will place this sprite further towards the background.

sprite.name: Midway Flag
sprite.notes: A flag that when touched by the player will mark their progress in the level and respawn them at this location when re-entering the level.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines which Entrance the level will load the player into when they respawn.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the players will face when they respawn.
Once activated, the 1st checkpoint can not be deactivated by the 2nd checkpoint, and vise-versa.

sprite.name: Tile God Event
sprite.notes: The Tile God can Create / Change / Destroy tiles within a specified area when an Event is activated.

dependency.notes: The Tile God sprite can be placed no more than one block outside of the Zone it is being activated in for it to function.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the Tile God's area will be created or destroyed, depending on the Mode.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the area that is affected.

list.title: Target Layer
list.comment: This determines which terrain layer is affected.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is activated.
dualbox.comment2: When creating, the Tile God will place these tiles on top of existing tiles instead of replacing them.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is deactivated
dualbox.comment2: When set to Reverse, previously created tiles will be destroyed, and locations where tiles were destroyed will be filled by the creation settings of the Tile God.

checkbox.title: Disable Effects
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the visual effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (332) to add your own effect in its place.

checkbox.title: Disable Sounds
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the sound effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (332) to add your own sound in its place.

list.title: Pattern
list.comment: This determines the fill pattern for the Tile God's selected area.
list.comment2: A checkered pattern and reverse checked pattern overlapping will create the same effect as a regular fill. This is sometimes useful for its visual effect.

list.title: Tile
list.comment: This determines what terrain tile will appear at the Tile God's selected area

value.title: Tileset Row
value.comment: When using [Tile: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15.
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

value.title: Tileset Column
value.comment: When using [Block Type: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15.
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

sprite.name: Huckit Crab
sprite.notes: A crab enemy that will throw projectiles at the player while occasionally jumping in the air.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Huckit Crab.

list.title: Shooting Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the projectile that the Huckit Crab will huck.
list.comment2: Many values are excluded due to abnormal or glitchy behavior.

list.title: Advanced / Glitchy Shooting Options
list.comment: A full list of the Shooting Speed options including duplicates and those not suggested for use.
list.advancedcomment: Many values will cause the Huckit Crab to toss his projectile behind him. One option will also cause him to face the wrong direction, as well.

sprite.name: Giant Goomba
sprite.notes: A larger version of the Goomba that splits into two regular Goombas when stepped on.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Giant Goomba.
list.comment2: The smaller Goombas spawned correspond to it's recolor of the same value. This means that all smaller Goombas are the same color, except for Green, which is the normal brown at the smallest size.

sprite.name: Mega Goomba
sprite.notes: An even larger version of the Goomba that splits into two Giant Goombas when stepped on.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Mega Goomba.
list.comment2: The smaller Goombas spawned correspond to it's recolor of the same value. This means that all smaller Goombas are the same color, except for Green, which is the normal Brown at the smallest size.

sprite.name: Micro Goomba
sprite.notes: A very small Goomba that clings to the player until they spin jump to shake them off.

sprite.name: Chest
sprite.notes: A chest that will award some type of inventory item to the player. Note that opening a chest will complete the level with the standard exit.

dependency.notes:
NewerSMBW rewrote this sprite's settings data in a way that breaks Ambush levels. As such the following information is outdated. [432] is still required, however.

Requires ONE of these two sprites in order to not cause the game to crash. Which one depends on how the Chest is being used. If you're using it as part of an Ambush level, [454] is required. If you're using it without the Ambush arrangement, [432] is required to be placed somewhere in the level, even if it's outside of the active Zones. Additionally, if you allow the player to leave the vicinity of the Chest before it exits the player from the level, they will be able to open it again for another item, so do not allow the player to do this.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The Chest will only appear when the Triggering Event is 0 or is activated. It will not disappear if the Event is deactivated.

value.title: Number of Items Awarded
value.comment: This determines the number of different items awarded.
value.comment2:
[Bug] Item 5 mistakenly uses this value, so keep in mind this limits the possible awards.

If awarding 5 items, the 5th item must be a Star.
If awarding 6 items, the 5th item must be a Penguin Suit.
If awarding 7 items, the 5th item must be a Hammer.
You cannot award 8 items.

list.title: Item 1
list.comment: This determines what main item will appear from the Chest.

list.title: Item 2
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.

list.title: Item 3
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.

list.title: Item 4
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.

list.title: Item 5
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.
list.comment2:
[Bug] Item 5 mistakenly uses this value, so keep in mind this limits the possible awards.

If awarding 5 items, the 5th item must be a Star.
If awarding 6 items, the 5th item must be a Penguin Suit.
If awarding 7 items, the 5th item must be a Hammer.
You cannot award 8 items.

list.title: Item 6
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.
list.comment2: [Bug] Item 6 is visually a little bit glitchy, as the item awarded is shown nearby the chest.

list.title: Item 7
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.
list.comment2: [Bug] Item 6 is visually a little bit glitchy, as the item awarded is shown behind the chest.

sprite.name: Rolling Object Spawner
sprite.notes: A spawner that will create loose Spiked Balls or Rolling Barrels. <font color="red">Only Spiked Balls work in NewerSMBW. Rolling Barrels crash the game.</font>

dualbox.comment: <font color="Red">Spawning a rolling barrel will crash the game.</font>

value.title: Deactivation Event ID
value.comment: This Triggering Event ID will deactivate the Spiked Ball Spawner.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the spawned rolling object.
list.comment2: Stopped rolling objects will still be affected by the terrain they are resting on.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines the direction in which the spawned objects will roll in relation to the spawner.

value.title: Number of Objects Spawned
value.comment: This determines how many of the rolling object will spawn.
value.comment2: If set to 0, it will continuously spawn objects.

list.title: Grouping Mode
list.comment: This determines the rate at which the objects will spawn.
list.advancedcomment: Other values need to be tested. Also try to find out if there's a difference between values 3 and 4.
list.entry: Spawn three items, then long pause
Spawn three items, then short pause
Spawn one item, then long pause
Spawn one item, then long pause

sprite.name: ? Block
sprite.notes: Your most basic, most flexible, standard Question Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn enough for every player! Such a generous block~

dependency.notes: If pairing the ?-Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2: Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown. Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the ?-Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the ?-Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.

checkbox.title: Follows Lines
checkbox.comment: It is recommended to use [402] Line Controlled ? Block instead.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the ?-Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

sprite.name: (Unused) ? Block
sprite.notes: This is a nearly identical version of [207] to the point that you should probably just be using [207]...

dependency.notes: If pairing the ?-Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2:
Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown.
Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the ?-Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the ?-Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.
checkbox.advancedcomment: When this is checked, enemies will fall through the block from all sides, even from above. This is also the case for the block's final form (Used Block). The player cannot pass through the block.

sprite.name: Brick Block
sprite.notes: Your most basic, most flexible, standard brown Brick Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn only one, no matter how many players! Such a stingy block~

dependency.notes: If pairing the Brick Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2:
Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown.
Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release only one power-up item.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Brick Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the Brick Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.
checkbox.advancedcomment: When this is checked, enemies will fall through the block from all sides, even from above. This is also the case for the block's final form (Used Block). The player cannot pass through the block.

checkbox.title: Follows Lines
checkbox.comment: It is recommended to use [403] Line Controlled Brick Block instead.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Brick Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

sprite.name: Topman
sprite.notes: An enemy from Super Mario Galaxy that looks like a UFO with a spike on his head. He will walk off of platform edges and turn around at walls.

checkbox.title: Stands Still
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Topman will not walk towards the player.

checkbox.title: Low Gravity
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Topman will fall much more slowly.

sprite.name: Rolling Hill
sprite.notes: A rotating circle that has the same general appearance as various tilesets.

dependency.notes: The underside of a Rolling Hill does NOT have collision. Do not place a Rolling Hill in any situation where the player would have contact with the bottom 50% of the hill.

list.title: Style / Size
list.comment: This determines the style and size of the Rolling Hill.

value.title: Custom Size
value.comment: This determines the size of the Rolling Hill when using Flexible Size

list.title: Custom Style A
list.comment: This determines the tiling used on the Rolling Hill.
list.comment2: If nothing is selected, your game will crash. Please choose a value from the list or change [Style /Size].

list.title: Custom Style B
list.comment: This determines the tiling used on the Rolling Hill.
list.comment2: If nothing is selected, your game will crash. Please choose a value from the list or change [Style /Size].

value.title: Set me to 0 or the game will CRASH
value.comment: [64 Blocks (Underground)] is not compatible with Custom Size/Style and will cause your game to crash if this is not set to 0.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the rotation speed of the Rolling Hill. A value of 5 matches Mario's running speed, so use of higher values isn't recommended.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Rolling Hill rolls.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This determines the relative Z-Order placement of the Rolling Hill when compared to other Rolling Hills.
value.comment2: If you have multiple Rolling Hills overlapping each other, you must use this setting to prevent graphical glitches. Rolling Hills with a higher Z-Order number will show behind those with a lower number.

value.title: Hill ID
value.comment: This pairs matching Rolling Hill Coins to this hill.

sprite.name: Captain Bowser
sprite.notes: NewerSMBW's Final Boss fight features Bowser riding a small airship while lobbing junk at the players.

dependency.notes: Captain Bowser requires a lot of stuff hidden off in a corner of the level in order to function properly and without crashes. Beyond those, you will need a Clowncar with Cannon to damage him.

sprite.name: Stretching Line Block
sprite.notes: A platform made up of orange or other-colored blocks that shrinks and expands while moving up and down.

dependency.notes: This platform can be paired with [312] Stretching Line Block Controller in order to synchronize movement across multiple platforms.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Stretching Line Block.

value.title: Width - Top
value.comment: This determines the width of the platform when it is in its top position.

value.title: Width - Bottom
value.comment: This determines the width of the platform when it is in its bottom position.

dualbox.comment: This determines the initial direction the platform will move.

value.title: Stretch ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching controller for movement synchronization.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: This determines the distance between the top and bottom states of the platform.
value.comment2: The speed is constant and not based on how large the distance is, so larger distances will take longer to travel. Additionally, because the change in the number of blocks is accomplished in the same time period of time that it takes the Stretching Line Block to travel up or down, if the movement distance is 0 then the platform will grow or shrink immediately.

sprite.name: Invisible Block
sprite.notes: Your most sneaky, most annoying, hidden transparent Invisible Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn only one, no matter how many players! Such a rude block~
sprite.advancednotes: The tileset-based Invisible Blocks can be destroyed by sprites like Bob-ombs. Sprite-based Invisible Blocks however cannot be destroyed.

dependency.notes: If pairing the Invisible Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2:
Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown.
Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing synchronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will only release one power-up item. If the invisible block has 10 coins, it will stay in the used block graphic the entire time. Additionally, it won't release the extra few coins if the block is hit multiple times successfully.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Invisible Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the Invisible Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Invisible Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

sprite.name: Checkered Spring Block
sprite.notes: A block with a spring-like effect that allows the player to jump on it and bounce off of it in order to jump higher.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spring Block.

list.title: Alternate Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spring Block when the Alternate Color Pattern is enabled.

checkbox.title: Alternate Color Pattern
checkbox.comment: When enabled, it will use the alternate color.
checkbox.comment2: Using an Inverted Checkers variant allows you to string together a line of Spring Blocks and have them look nice.

sprite.name: Jumbo Ray
sprite.notes: A large manta ray enemy that the player can stand on. It cannot hurt the player and instead functions similarly to a platform.

dependency.notes: In order for the Jumbo Ray to respawn, you must include a Jumbo Ray Respawner. This sprite's vertical placement is irrelevant - the Jumbo Ray will always spawn from the bottom of the Zone. The sprite still needs to be placed within the Zone, however. For cleanliness sake, you should make the Zone a bit taller and use a Scroll Limiter pair along the bottom in order to hide the lower part of the zone.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Jumbo Rays.

value.title: Initial Delay?
value.comment: Definitely not measured in Mario seconds.

dualbox.comment: This determines the direction the Jumbo Ray will travel across the screen.

value.title: Altitude (Flight Route)
value.comment: This determines how high the Jumbo Ray will fly up from the bottom of the screen.
value.comment2: More research is required on the exact details of each number, but Retail levels use 1 and 2 with 2 being higher, while Newer also uses 0 which also seems to be fairly high.

value.title: Ray ID
value.comment: This determines which Jumbo Ray Respawner will influence the respawn of this Jumbo Ray.

sprite.name: Bramball
sprite.notes: A long-legged enemy with a ball for a body that will flip itself around as it traverses terrain with proper spacing. Rumor has it that if it is struck from below with a Pipe Cannon, a large amount of coins will appear. Kaching!

dependency.notes: A Bramball must have solid terrain exactly 4 tiles and no more than a 1 tile change in elevation to move.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Bramball.

dualbox.comment: This determines how quickly the Bramball will traverse platforms.

list.title: Initial Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the Bramball will attempt to move first.

sprite.name: Wiggling Mushroom Platform
sprite.notes: A mushroom platform that can tilt back and forth.

dependency.notes: Wiggling Mushroom Platforms may be paired with [313] Wiggling Mushroom Controller to enable synchronized movement across a Zone.

dualbox.comment: This determines whether or not the platform extends and contracts.

value.title: Wiggling Mushroom ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching Wiggling Mushroom Controller for synchronized movement. If an ID is set, that ID will control and override all matching Wiggle Speeds.

value.title: Tilt Distance
value.comment: This determines how much the platform will tilt. A value of 1 or 2 is recommended.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Mushroom Platform.

dualbox.comment: This determines the length of the stem when the platform is contracted.

sprite.name: Event Block
sprite.notes: A red or green block that, when struck, will affect the state of the Target Event(s). Events that are deactivated will become activated, and those that are activated will become deactivated.
sprite.advancednotes: Kamek code references the events by the opposite number.

dualbox.comment: This determines which associated Event IDs will be affected when the block is struck.
dualbox.comment2:
If set to Affect Event 1, Event 1 will be activated or deactivated and the color of the block will display the state of Event 1, green for on and red for off.

If set to Swap Events, Event 2 will be activated initially and Event 1 will be deactivated initially during the Zone loading. The color of the block will rely on Event 2's current state.

sprite.name: Line God Event
sprite.notes: The Line God can hide and show Line Guides within a specified area by using Events.

dependency.notes: The Line God cannot create new Line objects, only determine if the object within its affected area are displayed and functional.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the Line Guides affected by the Line God's area will be hidden or unhidden, depending on the Mode.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Width of the area affected by the Line God.

value.title: Height
value.comment: Height of the area affected by the Line God.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Line God will act when the Triggering Event is activated.
dualbox.comment2: When the event is not active, the Line Guides will exist in the opposite state from what's listed.

sprite.name: Newer Cutscene Controller: Credits
sprite.notes: <font color="red">This sprite is predominately hardcoded in how it functions. Custom usage is not recommended.</font>
sprite.advancednotes: It needs a very specific level set-up to function. Shows the Bowser cutscene that runs in a separate level.

sprite.name: Special Event
